1.text: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called as an Apostle, separated for the Gospel of God,

2.text: which he had promised beforehand, through his Prophets, in the Holy Scriptures,

3.text: about his Son, who was made for him from the offspring of David according to the flesh,

4.text: the Son of God, who was predestined in virtue according to the Spirit of sanctification from the resurrection of the dead, our Lord Jesus Christ,

5.text: through whom we have received grace and Apostleship, for the sake of his name, for the obedience of faith among all the Gentiles,

6.text: from whom you also have been called by Jesus Christ:

7.text: To all who are at Rome, the beloved of God, called as saints. Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

8.text: Certainly, I give thanks to my God, through Jesus Christ, first for all of you, because your faith is being announced throughout the entire world.

9.text: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit by the Gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I have kept a remembrance of you

10.text: always in my prayers, pleading that in some way, at some time, I may have a prosperous journey, within the will of God, to come to you.

11.text: For I long to see you, so that I may impart to you a certain spiritual grace to strengthen you,

12.text: specifically, to be consoled together with you through that which is mutual: your faith and mine.

13.text: But I want you to know, brothers, that I have often intended to come to you, (though I have been hindered even to the present time) so that I might obtain some fruit among you also, just as also among the other Gentiles.

14.text: To the Greeks and to the uncivilized, to the wise and to the foolish, I am in debt.

15.text: So within me there is a prompting to evangelize to you also who are at Rome.

16.text: For I am not ashamed of the Gospel. For it is the power of God unto salvation for all believers, the Jew first, and the Greek.

17.text: For the justice of God is revealed within it, by faith unto faith, just as it was written: “For the just one lives by faith.”

18.text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven over every impiety and injustice among those men who fend off the truth of God with injustice.

19.text: For what is known about God is manifest in them. For God has manifested it to them.

20.text: For unseen things about him have been made conspicuous, since the creation of the world, being understood by the things that were made; likewise his everlasting virtue and divinity, so much so that they have no excuse.

21.text: For although they had known God, they did not glorify God, nor give thanks. Instead, they became weakened in their thoughts, and their foolish heart was obscured.

22.text: For, while proclaiming themselves to be wise, they became foolish.

23.text: And they exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of flying things, and of four-legged beasts, and of serpents.

24.text: For this reason, God handed them over to the desires of their own heart for impurity, so that they afflicted their own bodies with indignities among themselves.

25.text: And they exchanged the truth of God for a lie. And they worshipped and served the creature, rather than the Creator, who is blessed for all eternity. Amen.

26.text: Because of this, God handed them over to shameful passions. For example, their females have exchanged the natural use of the body for a use which is against nature.

27.text: And similarly, the males also, abandoning the natural use of females, have burned in their desires for one another: males doing with males what is disgraceful, and receiving within themselves the recompense that necessarily results from their error.

28.text: And since they did not prove to have God by knowledge, God handed them over to a morally depraved way of thinking, so that they might do those things which are not fitting:

29.text: having been completely filled with all iniquity, malice, fornication, avarice, wickedness; full of envy, murder, contention, deceit, spite, gossiping;

30.text: slanderous, hateful toward God, abusive, arrogant, self-exalting, devisers of evil, disobedient to parents,

31.text: foolish, disorderly; without affection, without fidelity, without mercy.

32.text: And these, though they had known the justice of God, did not understand that those who act in such a manner are deserving of death, and not only those who do these things, but also those who consent to what is done.
